1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

2.brief: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

3.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

5.brief: to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope

6.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning

7.brief: to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
near, with or among; often in general, to

adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

8.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
